title: California fires: 190,000 flee for their lives as flames tear through US state

Almost 200,000 Californians have fled their homes as wildfires rage through the US state.

Sonoma County has been hardest hit in the latest spate of blazes, with 190,000 people evacuated.

The inferno, dubbed the Kincade Fire, has already destroyed more than 100 miles of land, with high winds being blamed for the disaster.

The wildfires have also hit Los Angeles, destroying several multimillion-dollar homes and prompting celebrities to flee the area.

(Image: Getty Images)

California Governor Gavin Newsom said: "I know this moment generates a tremendous amount of

anxiety.

"I'm not naive about shifting winds and shifting conditions so we are putting all the assets we have onto this fire."

As of yesterday the fires, which erupted on Wednesday night, had destroyed 66,000 acres (103 miles) and 96 homes and other structures in Sonoma County.

Among neighborhoods under evacuation orders was the posh area of Brentwood, Los Angeles, where former American football star O.J. Simpson was accused of killing his ex-wife and a waiter.

(Image: REUTERS)

Today it is home to basketball superstar LeBron James, A-list Hollywood actors, wealthy producers and media company executives.

Mr James, who plays for the Los Angeles Lakers, said he and his family had to drive around in the early morning hours looking for a place to stay after fleeing the home he shares with his wife and three children.

He bought a $23 million, eight-bedroom home in Brentwood in late 2017, according to media reports.

On the northern edge of Brentwood, a cluster of expensive homes were reduced to smoldering debris along a street festooned with Halloween decorations.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

A fake bloody arm, part of the holiday decorations, had turned into melted plastic at one dwelling, and a giant skull replica remained in the front of another.

Heavy smoke and ash filled the air as water-dropping helicopters and airplane tankers buzzed overhead.

Actor and former California Governor Arnold Schwarzenegger also said he was among the thousands who had to evacuate overnight.

(Image: SIPA USA/PA Images)

"If you are in an evacuation zone, don't screw around. Get out," Schwarzenegger wrote on Twitter.

A red-carpet premiere for Schwarzenegger's new movie, Terminator: Dark Fate, that had been scheduled for Monday night was canceled due to fires in the area.

The Terminator premiere had been scheduled to take place in Hollywood, several miles from the fire zone.
description: Wildfires have destroyed more than 100 miles of land in Sonoma County, California
